SEARCH
Package pt.ipp.isep.dei.esoft.project.repository

Class MachineRepository

java.lang.Object
pt.ipp.isep.dei.esoft.project.repository.MachineRepository
public class MachineRepository extends Object
Repository class for managing Machine objects. This class allows adding machines to the repository and retrieving them.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    MachineRepository()
    Constructs a new MachineRepository instance.

  • Constructor Details

    • MachineRepository

      public MachineRepository()
      Constructs a new MachineRepository instance. Initializes an empty HashMap to store Machine objects. Additionally, fills the repository with machines from an external data source by invoking the fillMachinery() method.

  • Method Details

    • addMachine

      public Optional<Machine> addMachine(Machine machine)
      Adds a new machine to the repository if it does not already exist.
      Parameters:
      machine - the Machine to be added to the repository
      Returns:
      an Optional containing a clone of the added machine if successful, or an empty Optional if the machine already exists

    • getMachineList

      public List<Machine> getMachineList()
      Retrieves all machines from the repository. The returned list is a new ArrayList containing the current machines, ensuring the original list is not modified.
      Returns:
      a List containing all Machine objects in the repository

    • requestMachineList

      public Optional<List<Machine>> requestMachineList()
      Requests the list of machines in the repository, wrapped in an Optional. If the repository is not empty, the method returns an Optional containing the list of machines. If the repository is empty, an empty Optional is returned.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing a List of machines if available, or an empty Optional if the repository is empty

    • registerMachine

      public Optional<Machine> registerMachine(Operation operation, int id, double exTime)
      Registers a new machine if the ID is unique.
      Parameters:
      operation - The operation to associate with the machine.
      id - The unique identifier for the machine.
      exTime - The execution time for the operation.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the registered machine if successful; otherwise, an empty Optional.

    • reformatMachineId

      public String reformatMachineId(String id)
      Reformats a machine ID by removing the non-numeric prefix and retaining only the numeric part.
      Parameters:
      id - The original machine ID as a string, e.g., "ws111".
      Returns:
      A new string representing only the numeric part of the machine ID, e.g., "111".
